description: IPv4 network connection events from endpoints. Captures outbound TCP/UDP connections for detecting C2 communications, data exfiltration, lateral movement, and network scanning.

columns.name: aid
columns.description: Agent ID - unique identifier for the endpoint

columns.name: cid
columns.description: Customer ID - unique identifier for the CrowdStrike tenant

columns.name: ComputerName
columns.description: Hostname of the endpoint making the connection

columns.name: UserName
columns.description: Username associated with the process making the connection

columns.name: UserSid
columns.description: Windows Security Identifier for the user (Windows only)

columns.name: LocalAddressIP4
columns.description: Source IPv4 address on the endpoint

columns.name: ContextProcessId
columns.description: Falcon's unique process identifier (UPID) for the process making the connection

columns.name: FileName
columns.description: Base filename of the process making the connection

columns.name: CommandLine
columns.description: Command line of the process making the connection

common_operations: Join with ProcessRollup2 via ContextProcessId (matched to TargetProcessId) for process context
CIDR-based filtering to exclude RFC1918/internal ranges
Network scanning detection via unique port count analysis
Port prevalence analysis (bottom 10% of port values)
C2 communication detection via IP reputation
Lateral movement detection (RDP port 3389, SMB port 445)
normalization_patterns: falconPID:=TargetProcessId | falconPID:=ContextProcessId - Normalize process ID for joining
UserID:=UserSid | UserID:=UID - Normalize user ID across platforms
